I believe the host lives above, but we heard very little movement. Only sounds seemed to be from the water system when our sink/shower/toilet were in use.

review_text: Larry's apartment is at the bottom of his home in a very quiet neighborhood. The off-street, gated parking is an unusual and valuable amenity, especially in a big city like Nashville. The apartment is spotlessly clean and decorated with so many interesting relics, antiques and impressive puzzles Larry's done himself! It is so clear that he has invested a great deal of thought, creativity, and care into this classy little abode. It is cozy but didn't feel cramped. (I was traveling alone but imagine no more than two people who are comfortable sharing a space would be happy here.) As others have said, I appreciated it being out of the chaos of the city of Nashville. I found it to be very quiet and didn't hear anyone above. Overall a good experience and a unique place to stay. I would definitely stay here again!

Larry went above and beyond to help us feel comfortable and welcome by making himself available to give each of us coaching on how to operate the gate and by giving me a pair of scissors when I needed it most.
The neighborhood seems extremely safe and country-like but only 10 minutes from the airport and 7 minutes from the Gaylord Opryland Resort Conference center. A wonderful find.
Somehow, I did not gather from the pictures (my perception, not their fault) that it is a single room and bathroom. If both beds are used, they are nearly touching. Worked out fine for us, yet worth noting.
Plenty of clean towels and very tidy and well-appointed bathroom and office area with a coffee spot and fridge. Very cute!

review_text:
Pros:
- Amazing location.
- Price.
- The pool, gym, and lobby are all great and the bed in the room is very comfortable. AC/Heater
Cons:
- Had an oven but no cookware. Had a washer and dryer but no detergent. Hand soap empty. 3 hangers in total. 1 pot and 1 pan. I had 4 prepackaged snacks compared to others receiving wine and fruit. There is no private work space that aligns with airbnbs defn.
- There is mold on the shower curtain and a bunch of half used products in the bathroom. Thereâ€™s also messy/spilt/uncapped cleaning products filling the cabinets.
- No windows, gets stuffy
- You have to pay to leave bags in the lobby, NOT disclosed here.
- Very loud upstairs neighbor, some party goers
- Messy closet (not like pic)
I also felt the host couldâ€™ve been more helpful to me. She was unprepared for my arrival, couldnâ€™t help me mail a package to the apartment and did not check in unless I reached out 1st aside from Latch probs. Good for short stay but inaccurate expectations set.

The shower curtain had mold stains that form when the curtain is closed and wet. We made the best of it and had a great time. We couldn't ask for a better host. I left my cosmetic back on a shelf in the bathroom, notified her and she mailed it to me the next day.
So again, she was great to work with!

review_text:
Place is really nice and pretty comfortable. Jon was very responsive to any communication, especially when we first had trouble getting in with the combination.
I would suggest a large doormat on the inside of the door downstairs to wipe off mud and leaves from shoes before going up into the loft.
Also, in the bathroom, I didn't have any room to put my toiletries out - toothpaste and toothbrush, face creams, etc. Maybe a little table right next to the sink?
We really didn't use the kitchen except for making coffee in the Keurig, but if we had, I feel like I would have liked to have some foil and plastic wrap, and also some sponges for wiping down both kitchen and bathroom sinks.
All in all, a really good stay. Thank you!
Michelle and Phil

we enjoyed our stay, and hopefully you do to!

review_text: My sister and I had a wonderful experience and Jon and Amandaâ€™s place. The location is absolutely perfect and near so many restaurants, eateries, and some really cute shops we found on our last day. Excellent and friendly neighborhood. We felt safe, comfortable, and private. Short Uber ride to downtown as well as other locations. We had no issues during our time there but Jon and Amanda would always remind us to reach out if we needed anything at all, whenever we ran into them. Apartment was super cute and comfortable enough for just us two. Everything worked well and check in was super easy. Only recommendations we have is that the couch should definitely be replaced as it stained on one side and is uncomfortable where the cushions constantly slide out. Also, the path to the loft can be uncomfortable to navigate especially if wearing heels or carrying heavy luggage as it cannot be rolled in. These were not deal breakers for us. A new couch and a better path to the loft and this can easily be one of the best Airbnbs in East Nashville! We recommend this place and would definitely stay again! Thanks again Jon and Amanda!

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
I made several recommendations upon checking out. The hosts left great info, recommendations, and directions upon arrival.
The cleanliness of the place was an issue for us though. There was gravel all over the entry way upon arrival and the walls were visibly dirty throughout. The floor is â€œrusticâ€ I would say, which is fine if youâ€™re going to regularly vacuum it since it cannot be swept. Any clothes laid of the floor were immediately covered in dust bunnies and the fans, window sills, etc. were also very dusty. A nightmare for those of us with severe allergies. There were stains on the living room furniture and ant issues throughout the place. I would not voluntarily shower without shoes, since the bathroom tile/grout was gross as well.
The one positive to this place is the price and location. I think it could really be a great place if there was more attention to detail. Lots of amazing food and drinking spots in East Nashville (Five Points Pizza, Edleyâ€™s BBQ, & Red Door Saloon) and just a short Uber ride to Broadway/downtown Nashville. Also, the hosts did take note of us visiting for our anniversary and left a bottle of champagne for us.
Overall, the positives just didnâ€™t outweigh the cleanliness issues for us so we will not be coming back.

Based on the reviews, we thought this would be a perfect place to stay during our trip in Nashville. I will say that the host is AWESOME! Jon responded to my messages very quickly and was very helpful.
I would say the cleanliness was the biggest issue. When we walked in, we immediately noticed a funky smell. Almost like old, wet wood, and that is kind of just the smell that the place has. The towels also didnâ€™t really smell clean. We also had an ant infestation at one point and this seems to be a common issue as there were ant traps all over the place in the loft. We did let the host know about this and he said he was going to get an exterminator over there after we left, so at least thereâ€™s that.
Another issue was the door. The door didnâ€™t lock when we left. We had to enter a code to get in initially but then when we left, we were instructed to lock the door from the inside and then close it and it would lock, but each time we returned to the loft we could get in by just trying the handle on the door.
The bed was very loud, but I thought comfortable. Itâ€™s a very soft mattress, so if you have back problems, it might be too soft for your needs.
Lastly, there are dogs that bark at you on either side of the fence when you walk down the path to enter the loft.
As I mentioned, the host of this place was great, but unfortunately the loft was what we expected, and we wished we wouldâ€™ve opted for a hotel for this trip. :(

rating_info:
Rating, 2 stars
,
Â·
May 2021
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The unit is as advertised. Nice little apartment above the garage. Easy to get in and out of, safe neighborhood, GREAT location.
The Friday evening I stayed there, the owners had a pool party that evening that went well into the night. Once it got dark outside the party moved to the garage or whatever is on the ground level which seemingly was directly below the bedroom and I was unable to sleep. It was very loud, rowdy, and reminiscent of my college days renting an apartment on campus. If my partner had been with me we would have put serious thought into leaving, but because I was a solo traveler and the door was deadbolted, I felt a higher degree of confidence that nothing too bad would happen.
Future travelers should take that into consideration, but I believe it would probably be a one-off.
A few notes future travelers should be aware of:
- there is 1 primary window near the office nook, at the top of the stairs, and it does it have a blind/curtain. It looks directly over the owners back yard, into their house, etc. I did not like that feeling so I hung up my own blind.
- I did not feel that the lock on the door knob was the most secure (an intruder could probably force the door open with little resistance), so any traveler should deadbolt when they can
- there is no shower curtain. Not a problem for me, but can see how it may not be the most ideal for others.
- the skylights are great, but the one in the bedroom is directly above the bed, meaning you may be waking up with the sun.

review_text:
Nice small space, looked as described. It fit my needs for the time I was there. The bed was very comfortable (sometimes I end up hurting after waking in a different bed then my own but I did not in this bed). The full size fridge was nice, and a stand up shower. I wish I would have brought house shoes to wear since the floor is slab and my feet froze when I walked around, so remember your house shoes or extra socks!
My only complaints would be: the door that sticks which made coming and going burdensome, especially when unloading and loading the car; unfortunately the couch was not comfortable at all, it looked nice in the space but I could not get comfortable and ended up using the bed as a couch; lastly the cost was pricey, I paid $705 for 3 nights (usually at this price point you get a lot of â€˜wowâ€™ moments for extra attention to detail, etc).
Overall the space fit my needs for the short time I was there. If you need a small clean space on your travels then this will work for you!

April 2022
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: This place is amazing! Location was great, in a nice neighborhood about 15 minutes outside of downtown. It was very quiet! We heard some footsteps from the owners upstairs but it was never bothersome, just something to note. Everything that we needed was included, from shampoo to cookware. We stayed for 5 nights and could have used an extra towel or two- 3 were provided, which is more than enough for shorter stays, but guests staying longer may want to bring a few extras. The space was beautiful and relaxing, which was exactly what we were hoping for in contrast to the bustle of downtown. The bed and pillows were very comfortable and allowed us to have a restful visit. Jack and Rachel were very unobtrusive but available and helpful with anything we needed. I would absolutely recommend this stay for anyone in the Nashville area that is looking to have a peaceful trip!

review_text: We had a fabulous three-night stay in Nashville at Jimmyâ€™s place. It was an ideal location, five minutes by car to the downtown. We loved the neighborhood in and of itself - we walked a lot and we really enjoyed Barcelona Wine Bar, BarTaco, 8th & Roast Coffee Shop, and Five Daughters Bakery. Downtown, we parked in the lot between the Farmers Market and the Tennessee State Museum. We visited both, and that parking lot has no time limit so we just left our car there and walked to other downtown sights. We had an amazing dinner at the Mockingbird, and we stopped by one of the downtown hotels and got the number to enter the Red Phone Booth. That was a treat. Jimmy could not have been any nicer or a better communicator. The space is filled with natural light, and I loved his styling. We did a lot of sightseeing during our stay, and it was great to â€œgo homeâ€ to such a relaxing and beautiful space.

I appreciated having an upscale environment to enjoy that was quiet and because I was traveling alone I truly felt safe in this building. Below was a great place to have a bite and get some great coffee and down the road I could walk to get dinner. This was my first visit to Nashville, a birthday weekend, and Jimmy's place was exactly what I needed to be centrally located and able to meet up with my friends.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: The condo is just steps away from a Publix, a Liquor store, a cute Mexican restaurant with great margaritas...go for the big one or go home...and the "must try" Hattie's B's. I highly recommend ML Rose for great beers and burgers. We ubered our way into Nashville's museums and down to Broadway - all minutes away. Loser's Bar was a great stop with a great band playing but honestly, you can't go wrong anywhere downtown. There's so much going on. For a real Nashville experience I recommend The Listening Room, it was the highlight for us, there was nothing that compared to hearing artists perform their own material in an intimate setting. We had hoped to make it to the Bluebird Cafe for a similar experience but it was sold out during our stay. We'll be back for a Nascar race or Predators game! The condo itself was clean, equipped, quiet, and comfy. The perfect place for the 2 of us. Jimmy was very accomodating and easy to communicate with. Thanks so much for hosting us.

The Melrose / Berry Hill area is perfect if you want to escape to a quieter area after a full days experience. Jimmy's condo is just a mile or two from South Broadway, 12 South, and the Gulch, which made it absolutely perfect! Melrose is also a fun area with plenty of restaurants and nice neighborhoods to walk or run. The condo itself was extremely nice. Jimmy has it decorated beautifully and it has all the modern amenities you need. The bed is exceptionally comfortable as is the rest of the furnishings. Parking was included and getting in and out of the building was a cinch. If you're visiting Nashville I would definitely recommend Jimmy's condo. We will definitely be staying here again!

,

Stayed over a week
review_text:
We've stayed in one-bedroom apts all over the 12 South and Music Row area in the past 3 years and Jimmy's is one of our favorites. We were here for 3 weeks. The apartment is spotlessly clean, quiet, spacious; the kitchen is well equipped, it's very comfortable and pleasantly decorated, and everything works as it should. It's an easy walk to shops, the Publix, etc...and behind you is the 8S/12S residential neighborhood, which is nice for walking. This is a 'junior executive' one bedroom, which means that one bedroom wall is a partial wall so if you are light sensitive, eyeshades will take care of it. For an apartment, it's extremely quiet - you cannot hear any traffic noise from adjoining 8S because the apartment faces the back of the building (more than making up for the view over the parking lot). There are big windows and lots of natural light since the apartment is on the fourth floor. There is a designated parking spot.
Jimmy was also very quick to respond to emails and provided 2 key fobs. Needless to say, we would be delighted to return.

We enjoyed our stay and the location of the place. Itâ€™s a cute little bungalow and was the perfect size for the two of us. Quite clean as well.
A great breakfast sandwich place called Egghill is a couple of blocks away and well worth the short walk.(we went there two mornings in a row!) Also, try OSA coffee thatâ€™s right around the corner from Egghill. Good stuff!
A couple of drawbacks were the water pressure is very low in the bathroom sink and the water temperature fluctuates a bit in the shower. The couch/sofa bed shown in the pictures does not match what is in the unit. It was confusing to try and set up(and uneven) so we just used the cushions provided for it and put them directly on the floor.
All in all, I would recommend this place and would stay here again.

This was a wonderful place to stay when visiting Nashville. We wandered to many different areas and hit up some pretty great local spots for eats - walk to Egghill (8 minutes) for a delicious and hearty crafted egg breakfast sandwich! We walked about 10 minutes toward Ruby Sunshine which offered a nice outside eat option for brunch as well. Food was plentiful..tons of options and this brunch spot sits on a really nice shopping street.
The place itself to stay was excellent. Clean and super super quiet. We had incredibly restful sleeps and it was so nice to come back home to a chill and comfortable space after a full day of being out and about with busy crowds and loud music. We appreciated the ability to have a safe storage space for our luggage before and after check in.
We didnâ€™t use the kitchen but itâ€™s quite functional.
Mark and family were very responsive to any questions we had and responded really quickly which was appreciated. Check in and check out was beyond seamless.
I wouldnâ€™t hesitate to recommend this place. It was a wonderful stay.

,

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Our stay at the treehouse was idyllic! It's obvious that it was built with care and intention. The surroundings are very peaceful and lush. All the big windows let in a ton of natural light in and the views really made us feel like we were up in the trees. The balcony overlooks the creek below and was a great spot to have our morning tea and appreciate the nature around us. That combined with the hot tub, vinyls, pickleball court, and farm-fresh eggs our first day (nice touch!) made this a perfect stay.
Nashville is a quick 30-minute drive away. Easy to do city things while staying here. We rented a car and that worked well (I don't recommend Uber or Lyft for this location since it's more remote).
Privacy wasn't an issue for us, but if you're looking for total privacy, you may not find it here. The treehouse neighbors the host's cabin and residence. We felt like we had enough privacy to fully enjoy the property. All in all, this was a fantastic Airbnb and I would stay there again.

The treehouse was so beautiful! My partner and I just wanted to get away from our regular hustle and bustle and this place provided in spades. It was every bit as romantic and dreamy as we had hoped!
The hosts are so kind and cool- we had tornado warnings on the way in and they let us hang out with them while the weather passed and gave us some wonderful tea!
Our trip began before our trip and the description helped us with that. We listened to records we brought, we made meals we packed together in a beautiful kitchen surrounded by natureâ€™s beauty through the many windows . We played Baldurs gate together on a saved game with a monitor we brought. (Note: there is not tv and the internet and cell reception are sparse (which is perfect and what we wanted) so for you gamer kids that want to be in nature and spend time together doing something you love- do prepare!)
It was a perfect getaway with serene surroundings. So grateful that such a lovely place exists. ğŸ’œ

review_text:
The treehouse had a beautifully designed interior. Even though the treehouse is fairly close to a residence and another rental, you really do feel like youâ€™re alone in the woods while inside because of the huge windows facing the woods and the thought-out placement of the treehouse.
We stayed here the night after our wedding and we were looking forward to cooking a meal together and binging our current show. However, we were not able to cook because we could not find a pan to use on the stove top and the oven would trigger the smoke alarm every time we tried to turn it on to pre-heat (even though nothing was in the oven and there was no smell/smoke). We also had to resort to streaming on a phone because the wifi was not usable for streaming on a laptop. We enjoyed our stay here and it was so dreamy and relaxing to look at the windows watching the rain while drinking coffee. We just thought that for the price we paid, it was not acceptable that the wifi and oven/stove were unusable.

review_text: The photos of this gorgeous treehouse did not do it justice! It was impeccably clean and quite literally, something out of a dream. We arrived during a record-breaking cold snap (9 degrees) and the fireplace / ductless split did a solid job of keeping the place warm for the most part (hot water finally froze up on our last day), so I would expect absolutely perfect temperatures inside during any other regular time of the year. This was certainly not the fault of the treehouse hosts but the result of some extreme weather. We enjoyed the farm-fresh eggs and butter very much. The hot tub was wonderful. Snow kept us from venturing out as much as we had intended, but the treehouse was definitely an ideal spot to cozy up in for a couple of days. I would say that we kind of expected the deck and stairs to be shoveled at some point during our stay or for us to be provided a shovel. Overall the loveliest stay and we hope to return in the very near future. We highly recommend this treehouse!

Nick & Destiny

review_text:
I was a little worried when other guests said they got a boot on their car cause of parking. I'm here to tell you that there was no problem finding it! I did do a lap around the building before going to grab the parking pass. I was then easily able to spot the alley where the parking garage was. I even messaged Rindi with a picture of my car and the spot and he quickly responded.
We arrived in the morning and Rindi let us do a early check in! I was extremely grateful for that and it was a life saver. We were right next to the pool which did get loud but that's to be expected. They manage the pool down there so everyone was done swimming by 8pm so it was then quiet.
It's a quick walk to broadway and literally around the corner to ol smoky. My kids loved that the parlor donuts were right when you stepped out the building!
Rindi is an amazing host. So fast to respond, clean place, washer/ dryer and even had things like laundry soap, beer and water in the fridge. 100% would stay again.

review_text: Rindi's condo is an absolute gem! Rindi added many extra touches, from the Keurig coffee pods and granola bars, to the cold beer in the refrigerator! The gym, swimming pool and courtyard were added bonuses! The location is within walking distance to Bridgestone Arena and the famous Honkey Tonk Highway on Broadway. I'm definitely adding this to my list of Air B&B's to visit again! Thank you Rindi, for your Five Star stay!
